item.title: Panama City Beach with My 70-Pound Dog: Embassy Suites Review
item.description:
Last month, Ansel and I made the drive from Jacksonville to Panama City Beach for a long weekend. I’d been eyeing the Embassy Suites by Hilton Panama City Beach Resort for a while ‚Äî it’s pet-friendly, right across from the beach, and I had a stack of Hilton points burning a hole in my account. Here’s how it went.

Someone approved of the room upgrade.

The Booking

I used my Hilton Honors American Express Surpass points plus a free night certificate to book this stay. The only thing I actually paid out of pocket? Tipping the valet. That’s it.

Pet fees: $75 for stays of 1-4 nights, or $125 for 5+ nights. They allow up to 2 pets, max 75 lbs each, dogs and cats only. No breed restrictions. Ansel is a 70-pound German Shorthaired Pointer/Lab mix, so he squeaked in under the limit.

Pro tip: If you have Hilton Diamond status, request a room upgrade when you book. I asked and got bumped to a king suite with an ocean view and a balcony. Ansel spent a solid 20 minutes every morning just watching the beach from up there.

(New to points and hotel status? Check out my guide to the best credit cards for pet travelers and how Hilton Diamond status works.)

The Hotel: What You Need to Know

The Embassy Suites PCB is located right by Pier Park, across the street from the beach. Not beachfront, but close enough that it’s a 5-minute walk to sand.

Here’s the thing nobody tells you: there’s only one elevator.

If you’re traveling with a dog ‚Äî especially a bigger one who needs to go out first thing in the morning ‚Äî request a room close to the elevator. I didn’t think to ask, and our first morning involved a very long hallway walk with an increasingly urgent pup. Lesson learned.

The room itself was spacious (it’s a suite, so you get a separate living area), clean, and the balcony was a huge win. Ansel could hang out there while I got ready without feeling cooped up.

Note: Dogs are not allowed at the pool. If you want pool time, you’ll need to plan around it (more on that below).

Need a Break? Daycare & Grooming Options

Sometimes you want to hit the pool or grab dinner somewhere that isn’t dog-friendly. Here are your options near the hotel:

  • ZOOMIES Pet Hotel ‚Äî Full daycare, boarding, and grooming. Book ahead, especially on weekends.
  • Dagny and Dexter’s ‚Äî Another solid daycare option nearby.
  • PetSmart in Pier Park ‚Äî Right next door for grooming or supplies. I dropped Ansel off here for a grooming session so I could spend a few hours at the pool.

I’d recommend booking daycare in advance if you know you’ll want pool time or want to explore without the dog for a day.

Road Trip Essentials: What I Packed

A few things that made the drive with a 70-pound dog way easier:

  • Backseat cover ‚Äî I use this seat cover in my 4Runner. It protects the seats, gives Ansel a non-slip surface, and makes cleanup a breeze. Worth every penny.

  • Travel water bottle with bowl ‚Äî This one attaches right to a cup holder. Perfect for rest stops without having to dig through bags.

  • Poop bags ‚Äî I always overpack these. You never know when you’ll need them, and running out at a hotel is not the move.

(For my full packing list, check out road trip essentials for traveling with your dog.)

The Verdict

This was a genuinely easy trip. The hotel is well-located for a dog-friendly beach weekend, the points redemption felt like good value, and Ansel had a blast.

Would I go back? Yeah, probably. Next time I’ll be smarter about requesting a room near the elevator, and I’ll book daycare in advance so I can get more pool time.

Ansel’s Rating: 4/5 Paws üêæüêæüêæüêæ

What he loved: The balcony. The beach. All the new smells at Pier Park.

What he didn’t love: That long hallway walk at 6am.

Quick Reference

Detail Info
Hotel Embassy Suites by Hilton Panama City Beach Resort
Location Across from beach, next to Pier Park
Pet Policy 2 pets max, 75 lbs each, dogs/cats only, no breed restrictions
Pet Fee $75 (1-4 nights) or $125 (5+ nights)
Points Used Hilton Honors (via Surpass card + free night cert)
Out of Pocket Valet tip only
Dog-Friendly Beach Walking distance
Pool No dogs allowed ‚Äî use grooming/daycare for pool time
Grooming PetSmart in Pier Park
Daycare ZOOMIES Pet Hotel, Dagny and Dexter’s (book ahead!)
Room Tip Request a room near the elevator

Have you stayed here with your pup? Drop a comment below or find me on Instagram @thepointspup.

item.title: About
item.description:
Hey, I’m Dani üëã

I’m a software engineer based in Jacksonville, Florida ‚Äî and I haven’t paid for a hotel stay in years.

A few years ago, a friend introduced me to credit card points and hotel loyalty programs. I went down the rabbit hole, learned the system inside and out, and built a strategy that keeps me traveling without spending cash on hotels. Between Hilton Honors points, free night certificates, and stacking welcome offers, I’ve turned loyalty programs into a reliable way to travel for free.

Why Pet Travel?

This is Ansel ‚Äî my 2-year-old German Shorthaired Pointer/Lab mix. He’s 70 pounds of energy, curiosity, and enthusiasm for literally everything. He loves hiking, chasing birds, meeting new people, and going anywhere that isn’t the house.

He’s well-trained enough that I can take him to restaurants, breweries, and patios without any issues. But I wanted more for us ‚Äî road trips, beach weekends, and new places to explore together.

The problem? Flying with a 70-pound dog isn’t really an option. So I combined what I know about points and hotel programs with deep research on pet policies, fees, and what actually works for travelers with big dogs.

That’s how ThePointsPup started.

What You’ll Find Here

  • Trip reports from dog-friendly destinations
  • Credit card strategies for earning hotel points fast
  • Honest hotel reviews with real info on pet policies and fees
  • Road trip guides focused on the Southeast and beyond

The Setup

Cards I Use:

  • Hilton Honors American Express Aspire
  • Hilton Honors American Express Surpass

My Dog: Ansel, 2-year-old GSP/Lab mix, 70 lbs, very good boy

Home Base: Jacksonville, FL

Have a pet-friendly hotel you want me to check out? A destination you’re curious about? Reach out ‚Äî I’m always looking for the next trip.

item.title: Affiliate Disclosure
item.description:
How ThePointsPup Makes Money

Some of the links on this site are affiliate links. That means if you click through and sign up for a credit card, book a hotel, or buy a product, I may earn a commission at no extra cost to you.

This is how I keep the site running and fund future trips to review for you.

What This Means for You

  • You don’t pay more. Affiliate links don’t add any cost to your purchase or application.
  • My opinions are my own. I only recommend cards, hotels, and products I actually use or would use. If something isn’t worth it, I’ll say so.
  • I’m selective. Not every affiliate offer makes it onto this site ‚Äî just the ones that make sense for pet travelers.

Programs I Participate In

  • Credit card affiliate networks (for cards like the Hilton Aspire and Surpass)
  • Amazon Associates (for pet travel gear)
  • Hotel booking partners

Questions?

If you ever want to know whether a link is an affiliate link, just ask. I’m happy to be transparent about it.

Thanks for supporting ThePointsPup ‚Äî it helps me keep doing what I do.

item.title: Contact
item.description:
Get in Touch

Have a question about a hotel’s pet policy? Want me to review a destination? Just want to say hi?

I’d love to hear from you.

Email: woof@thepointspup.com

I do my best to respond within a few days. If you’re asking about a specific hotel or trip, the more details the better ‚Äî it helps me give you a useful answer.

A Few Things I Get Asked

“Can you review [hotel/destination]?” Always open to suggestions. If it’s pet-friendly and accessible by road trip, it’s on my radar.

“What credit card should I get?” Depends on your situation ‚Äî how much you travel, which hotels you prefer, and what perks matter to you. Shoot me a message and I can point you in the right direction.

“Can I send you free stuff?” If it’s relevant to pet travel, sure ‚Äî reach out and let’s talk.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description:
Last updated: December 2024

The Short Version

I collect minimal data, I don’t sell your information, and I use cookies only for basic site functionality and analytics.

Information I Collect

If you email me: I’ll have your email address and whatever you share in your message. I use this only to respond to you.

Automatically: Like most websites, this site collects basic analytics data ‚Äî things like what pages you visit, how long you stay, and what device you’re using. This helps me understand what content is useful.

Cookies

This site uses cookies for:

  • Analytics ‚Äî to see how people use the site (I use privacy-friendly analytics)
  • Affiliate links ‚Äî when you click a credit card or product link, the affiliate program may set a cookie to track the referral

You can disable cookies in your browser settings, but some features may not work properly.

Affiliate Links & Third Parties

Some links on this site are affiliate links. When you click them, you may be redirected to a third-party site (like a credit card issuer or Amazon) that has its own privacy policy. I’m not responsible for their practices.

Affiliate partners I work with may include:

  • Credit card affiliate networks
  • Amazon Associates
  • Hotel booking partners

Your Data

I don’t sell your personal information. Ever.

If you’ve emailed me and want your information deleted, just ask.

Changes

I may update this policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page.

Questions?

Email me at woof@thepointspup.com.
